tweets.text: There is a lot of water in the drains, watercourses and lagoons at the moment, but Hull City Council and our @LivingWithH2O partners @EnvAgencyYNE @YorkshireWater and @ERfloodrisk are aware and are working together around the clock to try and keep the water where it belongs! https://t.co/KjDZq6iQlY
We’ll issue #flood alerts and warnings as necessary. Please check your flood risk and sign up for free warnings. https://t.co/0XnS3EPxO5 https://t.co/PYTH2m1i0B

The essential maintenance we needed to carry out at Currymoor has been successfully completed this afternoon, we will continue to operate the Sowy over the weekend in preparation for the rain that is forecast for Saturday. #Monksleaze #Sowy #KSD 
@EnvAgencySW https://t.co/lF9V99vKbL

🤷‍♂️why is this still being allowed to happen? @EnvAgencyAnglia @JamesBevanEA @EmmaHowardBoyd @WestNorfolkBC @jamesowild @NorfolkCC @The_WMA @AnglianWater @N_Rivers_Trust @theriverstrust @WNGreens @Feargal_Sharkey https://t.co/mnQ81QovDi

With the water level temporarily lowered by 1m for dam repairs, the dreadful neglect of #SSSI Brent Reservoir (Welsh Harp) is stark. Not enough being done. Act now! | @NaturalEngland @CRTContactUs @Brent_Council @EnvAgency @ChrisGPackham @WildLondon @thames21 https://t.co/ojH4magew5

tweets.text: @PeterMassini @DeTom48 @SE_Rivers_Trust @SussexFlow There is much more we do on protecting homes and businesses from flooding than clearing rivers of debris, Peter. But the work in the photos is SO important AND undervalued. Peter

@shandy_defender @EnvAgencyYNE @RotherValley There’s a study in #CalderValley with @YorkshireWater where the EA essentially buys the top 10% of the reservoir so it can be used as a buffer in flood events.

We’re hoping we can then translate that to some other reservoirs in our patch but I don’t which ones might be in scope.

The @EnvAgency have issued a flood warning, so North Bank Road will close to traffic between Bedford Cottages and Dog in a Doublet until further notice. 

Diversion route is via Whittlesey Road B1040, Station Road,  A47, Paston Parkway and Parnwell Way and vice versa. https://t.co/tVhCx6eKak

tweets.text: @AdamBaylissEA @EnvAgencyYNE @RotherValley What about Ulley then, run it at a lower level, with a compensatory flow out, but maintaining a head room for peak flows. Currently, it's always run full, then it rains and flows over the spill way.

FLOOD PATROL UPDATE 5pm 15/1/21 👇 see pics for details of Road Closures 🚧⚠️
@LR4x4Response @benvolresponder @CharnwoodBC @LeicsCountyHall @ATCLeicester @EnvAgencyMids @FloodDigitalEA @CharnwoodPolice @leicspolice @BBCLeicester @leicslive @MountsorrelPar1 @fosse107 @SilebyPC https://t.co/K8FWruX8Yz
Flood even!

#TeamEA have cleared a blocked culvert along Baguley Brook that caused upstream flooding & had potential to damage property, putting the community at risk.
                       
Always take your rubbish home and do not dump waste into watercourses as this could pose #FloodRisk https://t.co/e9ujD89Qcy

@Feargal_Sharkey @MonkeyTennis14 @NaturalEngland @CRTContactUs @Brent_Council @EnvAgency @ChrisGPackham @WildLondon @Thames21 @CanalRiverTrust You’re right, Feargal, but several bodies overlap - CRT (reservoir), Env Agency (river traps), Brent & Barnet Council (the open space and water’s edge), Natural England (SSSI status) - and not much gets done at the joint committee. Needs attention.

tweets.text: @AdamBaylissEA @EnvAgencyYNE @RotherValley A huge flood reservoir then, has it ever been full? I guess 2007?

Tree works taking place by @GroundControlGC for the @EnvAgency on the River Rase, this project is being done to improve maintenance conditions for the reservoir banking, because of the banks importance all work is being done to reduce any damage standard operations could cause. https://t.co/uCVv97UPyS

@MonkeyTennis14 @ben_watt @NaturalEngland @CRTContactUs @Brent_Council @EnvAgency @ChrisGPackham @WildLondon @Thames21 I'm familiar with Brent Reservoir. It's fed by Silk Stream and River Brent, both fairly sick little rivers, they're really just drainage ditches for large parts of north London. If I remember the reservoir is owned by the @CanalRiverTrust and used to top up the Grand Union Canal.

urls.title: Massive new flood gate fitted in York
urls.description: The new gate will be air-lifted in place as part of £38 million Foss Barrier upgrade.

tweets.text:
A new replacement gate is being air-lifted into place at the Foss Barrier in #York next week as part of a £38m upgrade that will reduce #flood risk to around 1,200 properties https://t.co/i7onQwWAZx

Our Mark Fuller explains how this will be carried out @CityofYork https://t.co/n96OREfxrx

Our Field Teams have been out through the night clearing blockages, like this one in Chapel on Frith, to ensure watercourses are running clear ahead of potential heavy 🌧️

Check #flood risk in your area & sign up for flood warnings 

👉 https://t.co/uGQ4g6A5Xn #PrepareActSurvive https://t.co/QLBMcibJA3
No Ellie, it’s not the potty, it’s Daddy’s hard hat!! PPE dilemmas!! https://t.co/Pzi7kjV5rK

tweets.text: @NaturalEngland @CRTContactUs @Brent_Council @EnvAgency @ChrisGPackham @WildLondon @Thames21 Welsh Harp is steeped in history and scientific importance. Great work done for decades by local conservation groups but joined-up action and funding from public & private official bodies is well overdue. No visit in 6 yrs from Natural England.

tweets.text: @NaturalEngland @CRTContactUs @Brent_Council @EnvAgency @ChrisGPackham @WildLondon @Thames21 Biodiversity threatened by Giant Hogweed, Himalayan Balsam, Japanese Knotweed, contaminated silt, microplastics, lack of dredging, sluggish consultative committee, absence of rangers, no cohesive management. One of London’s premier SSSI’s deserves better.
